maml:description.maml:para: Add a new attachment to an existing Confluence page.
Add Attachments (one or more) to Confluence pages (one or more). If the Attachment did not exist previously, it will be created.
This will not update an already existing Attachment; see Set-Attachment for updating a file.

maml:Description.maml:para: The ID of the page to which apply the Attachment to. Accepts multiple IDs, including via pipeline input.
The URi of the API interface. Value can be set persistently with Set-Info.
Confluence's credentials for authentication. Value can be set persistently with Set-ConfluenceInfo.
Certificate for authentication.
One or more files to be added.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs.
The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
The URi of the API interface. Value can be set persistently with Set-Info.

Certificate for authentication.
The ID of the page to which apply the Attachment to. Accepts multiple IDs, including via pipeline input.
One or more files to be added.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs.
The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Adds the Attachment test.png to the wiki page with ID 123456. -Verbose output provides extra technical details, if interested.
Simulates adding the Attachment test.png to all pages in the space with key SRV. -WhatIf provides PageIDs of pages that would have been affected.

maml:description.maml:para: Add a new global label to an existing Confluence page.
Assign labels (one or more) to Confluence pages (one or more).
If the label did not exist previously, it will be created. Preexisting labels are not affected.

maml:Description.maml:para: The ID of the page to which apply the label to. Accepts multiple IDs, including via pipeline input.
The URi of the API interface. Value can be set persistently with Set-Info.
Confluence's credentials for authentication. Value can be set persistently with Set-ConfluenceInfo.
Certificate for authentication.
One or more labels to be added. Currently only supports labels of prefix "global".
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
The URi of the API interface. Value can be set persistently with Set-Info.
Confluence's credentials for authentication. Value can be set persistently with Set-ConfluenceInfo.
Certificate for authentication.
The ID of the page to which apply the label to. Accepts multiple IDs, including via pipeline input.
One or more labels to be added. Currently only supports labels of prefix "global".
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Apply the label alpha to the wiki page with ID 123456. -Verbose output provides extra technical details, if interested.
Simulates applying the label "servers" to all pages in the space with key SRV. -WhatIf provides PageIDs of pages that would have been affected.
Applies the label "abc" to all pages in the space with key DEMO. -Confirm prompts Yes/No for each page that would be affected.

maml:description.maml:para: Convert your content to Confluence's storage format.
To properly create/edit pages, content should be in the proper "XHTML-based" format. Invokes a POST call to convert from a "wiki" representation, receiving a "storage" response.

maml:Description.maml:para: A string (in plain text and/or wiki markup) to be converted to storage format.
The URi of the API interface. Value can be set persistently with Set-ConfluenceInfo.
Confluence's credentials for authentication. Value can be set persistently with Set-ConfluenceInfo.
Certificate for authentication.
The URi of the API interface. Value can be set persistently with Set-ConfluenceInfo.
Confluence's credentials for authentication. Value can be set persistently with Set-ConfluenceInfo.
Certificate for authentication.
A string (in plain text and/or wiki markup) to be converted to storage format.

dev:remarks.maml:para:
Stores the returned value '

Hello world!

' in $Body for use in New-ConfluencePage/Set-ConfluencePage/etc.
Pipe the current date/time in sortable format, returning the converted string.

maml:description.maml:para: Convert your content to Confluence's wiki markup table format.
Formats input as a table with a horizontal header row. This wiki formatting is an intermediate step, and would still need ConvertTo-ConfluenceStorageFormat called against it.
This work is performed locally, and does not perform a REST call.

maml:Description.maml:para: The object array you would like to see displayed as a table on a wiki page.
Create a vertical, two-column table.
Ignore the property names, keeping a table of values with no header row highlighting.
In a vertical table, the property names remain, but the bold highlighting is removed.
The object array you would like to see displayed as a table on a wiki page.
Create a vertical, two-column table.
Ignore the property names, keeping a table of values with no header row highlighting.
In a vertical table, the property names remain, but the bold highlighting is removed.

maml:alert.maml:para: Basically stolen verbatim from thomykay`s PoshConfluence SOAP API module. See links section.

dev:remarks.maml:para: List the first ten services on your computer, and convert to a table in Confluence markup format.
Following Example 1, convert the table from wiki markup format into storage format. Store the results in $SvcTable for a later New-ConfluencePage/etc. command.
Make a table of all one-character PowerShell aliases, and don't include the header row.

Output a vertical table instead. Property names will be a left header column with bold highlighting. Property values will be in a normal right column. Multiple objects will output as multiple tables, one on top of the next.
Output one string containing four vertical tables (one for each object returned). Property names are still displayed, but -NoHeader suppresses the bold highlighting.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieve the child Attachments of a given wiki Page.
Return all Attachments directly below the given Page.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Two different methods to return all Attachments directly below Page 123456. Both examples should return identical results.
Similar to the previous example, this shows two different methods to return the Attachments of multiple pages. Both examples should return identical results.
Returns the Attachment called test.png from Page 123456 if it exists.
Returns any attachments of mime type image/png from Page 123456.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves the binary Attachment for a given Attachment object.
Retrieves the binary Attachment for a given Attachment object.

As the files are stored in a location of the server that requires authentication, this functions allows the download of the Attachment in the same way as the rest of the module authenticates with the server.

The URi of the API interface. Value can be set persistently with Set-ConfluenceInfo.

Override the path used to save the files.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Save any attachments of page 123456 to the current directory with each filename constructed with the page ID and the attachment filename.
Save any attachments of page 123456 to a specific directory with each filename constructed with the page ID and the attachment filename.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Two different methods to return all wiki pages in space "HOTH". Both examples should return identical results.
Returns the wiki page with ID 123456. `Format-List *` displays all of the object's properties, including the full page body.
Return all pages in HOTH whose names start with "luke" (case-insensitive). Wildcards (*) can be inserted to support partial matching.
Return all pages containing the label "skywalker" (case-insensitive). Label text must match exactly; no wildcards are applied.
Return all pages matching the query.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Display the info of all spaces on the server.
Return only the space with key "HOTH" (case-insensitive).
`Format-List *` displays all of the object's properties.

Manually specifying a server and authentication credentials, list all spaces found on the instance. `Set-ConfluenceInfo` usually makes this unnecessary, unless you are actively maintaining multiple instances.

maml:description.maml:para: Invoke a specific call to a Confluence REST Api endpoint
Make a call to a REST Api endpoint with all the benefits of ConfluencePS.

This cmdlet is what the other cmdlets call under the hood. It handles the authentication, parses the response, handles exceptions from Confluence, returns specific objects and handles the differences between versions of Powershell and Operating Systems.

ConfluencePS does not support any third-party plugins on Confluence. This cmdlet can be used to interact with REST Api endpoints which are not already converted in ConfluencePS. It allows for anyone to use the same technics as ConfluencePS uses internally for creating their own functions or modules. When used by a module, the Manifest (.psd1) can define the dependency to ConfluencePS with the 'RequiredModules' property. This will import the module if not already loaded or even download it from the PSGallery.

maml:Description.maml:para: URI address of the REST API endpoint.
Certificate to use for the authentication with the REST Api.
If no sessions is available, the request will be executed anonymously.
Context which will be used for throwing errors.
Method of the HTTP request.
Body of the HTTP request.

By default each character of the Body is encoded to a sequence of bytes. This enables the support of UTF8 characters. And was first reported here: <https://stackoverflow.com/questions/15290185/invoke-webrequest-issue-with-special-characters-in-json>
This behavior can be changed with -RawBody.
Define a key-value set of HTTP headers that should be used in the call.
Define a key-value set of GET Parameters.
This is not mandatory, and can be integrated in the Uri. This parameter exists to facilitate the addition and removal of parameters in particular for paging
Path to a file that will be uploaded with a multipart/form-data request.
This parameter does not validate the input in any way.
Path to the file where the response should be stored to.
This parameter does not validate the input in any way
Define the Type of the object that will be returned by the call.
The casting to custom classes is done in private functions as uses the cast operator which throws a terminating error in case the response can't be casted.
Credentials to use for the authentication with the REST Api.
If no sessions is available, the request will be executed anonymously.
Keep the Body from being encoded.
NOTE: Not yet implemented. Causes an extra output of the total count at the beginning. Note this is actually a uInt64, but with a custom string representation.
Controls how many objects will be skipped before starting output.
Defaults to 0.
NOTE: Not yet implemented. Indicates how many items to return.

This behavior can be changed with -RawBody.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Executes a GET request on the defined URI and returns a collection of PSCustomObject
Executes a GET request on the defined URI and returns a collection of ConfluencePS.Page
Executes a POST request on the defined URI and returns a collection of ConfluencePS.Page.
This will example doesn't really do anything on the server, as the content API needs requires a value for the BODY. See next example

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 4 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
$body = '{"type": "page", "space": {"key": "TS"}, "title": "My New Page", "body": {"storage": {"representation": "storage"}, "value": "

LoremIpsum

"}}' $params = @{ Uri = "https://contoso.com/rest/api/content" Method = "POST" Body = $body Credential = $cred } Invoke-ConfluenceMethod @params

dev:remarks.maml:para: Executes a POST request with a JSON string in the BODY on the defined URI and returns a collection of ConfluencePS.Page.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 5 --------------------------

dev:remarks.maml:para: Executes a GET request on the defined URI with a Get Parameter that is resolved to look like this: ?expand=space,version,body.storage,ancestors&limit=30

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 6 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: $params = @{ Uri = "https://contoso.com/rest/api/content/10001/child/attachment" Method = "POST" OutputType = [ConfluencePS.Attachment] InFile = "c:\temp\confidentialData.txt" Credential = $cred } Invoke-ConfluenceMethod @params

dev:remarks.maml:para: Executes a POST request on the defined URI and uploads the InFile with a multipart/form-data request. The response of the request will be cast to an object of type ConfluencePS.Attachment.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 7 --------------------------

dev:remarks.maml:para: Executes a GET request on the defined URI and stores the output on the File System. It also uses the Headers to define what mimeTypes are expected in the response.

maml:description.maml:para: Create a new page on your Confluence instance.
Create a new page on Confluence.
Optionally include content in -Body. Body content needs to be in "Confluence storage format" -- see also -Convert.

Supply a ConfluencePS.Page object to use as the parent page.
Key of the space where the new page should exist.
Only needed if you don't specify a parent page.
Space Object in which to create the new page.
Only needed if you don't specify a parent page.
The contents of your new page.

Only needed if you don't specify a parent page.
The contents of your new page.
Optionally, convert the provided body to Confluence's storage format. Has the same effect as calling ConvertTo-ConfluenceStorageFormat against your Body.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Create a new blank wiki page at the root of space "Hoth".
Creates a new blank wiki page as a child page below "Darth Vader" in the specified space.
Creates a new blank wiki page as a child page below the wiki page with ID 123456.
-Verbose provides extra technical details, if interested.
Create a new wiki page named 'foo' at the root of space 'bar'. The wiki page will contain the data stored in $PageContents.
Create a new wiki page named 'foo' at the root of space 'bar'.
The wiki page will contain the text "Testing 123". -Convert will condition the -Body parameter's string into storage format.

maml:description.maml:para: Specify wiki location and authorization for use in this session's REST API requests.

Set-ConfluenceInfo uses scoped variables and PSDefaultParameterValues to supply URI/auth info to all other functions in the module (e.g. Get-ConfluenceSpace). These session defaults can be overwritten on any single command, but using Set-ConfluenceInfo avoids repetitively specifying -ApiUri and -Credential parameters.
Confluence's REST API supports passing basic authentication in headers. (If you have a better suggestion for how to handle auth, please reach out on GitHub!)
Unless allowing anonymous access to your instance, credentials are needed.

maml:Description.maml:para: Address of your base Confluence install. For Atlassian Cloud instances, include /wiki.
The username/password combo you use to log in to Confluence.
Default PageSize for the invocations. More info in the Notes field of this help file.
Prompt the user for credentials
Address of your base Confluence install. For Atlassian Cloud instances, include /wiki.
The username/password combo you use to log in to Confluence.
Default PageSize for the invocations. More info in the Notes field of this help file.
Prompt the user for credentials

maml:alert.maml:para: The default page size for all commands is 25. Using the -PageSize parameter changes the default for all commands in your current session.
Tweaking PageSize can help improve pipeline performance when returning many objects. See related links for implementation discussion and details.
(If you don't know exactly what this means, feel free to ignore it.)

dev:remarks.maml:para: Declare the URI of your Confluence instance; be prompted for username and password. Note that Atlassian Cloud Confluence instances typically use the /wiki subdirectory.
Declare the URI of your Confluence instance. You will not be prompted for credentials, and other commands would attempt to connect anonymously with read-only permissions.
Declare the URI of your Confluence instance; be prompted for username and password. Set the default "page size" for all your commands in this session to 50 (see Notes).
Declare the URI of your Confluence instance and the credentials (username and password).
